nodes.text: Kessel Runner was a fathier colt owned by Big Sturg Ganna. Kessel Runner was born to a sire and dame named Hydian Dreams and Distant Star in 31 ABY. He participated in fathier races at Canto Bight racetrack. Ridden by jockey Arca Yroca, Kessel Runner participated in a race that took place shortly before the Battle of Crait.

Kessel Runner was one of several possible names offered by Lucasfilm Story Group member Pablo Hidalgo to director Rian Johnson for use in Star Wars: Episode VIII The Last Jedi. The other options were Hoth Stuff and Mynock Minute. Johnson chose Hoth Stuff. The names "Kessel Runner" and "Mynock Minute" were later used in the novella collection Canto Bight and the replica journal The Last Jedi: Rose Tico: Resistance Fighter.
